conclusion: To solve this problem, let's break it down step by step.
Object A is a yellow cube.
Object B is a green cube.
Objects C, D, E, and F are already present in the scene.
Objects A and B are moving through the air.
They are being placed at the locations of objects C, D, E, and F respectively.
When an object moves through the air and is placed on another object, gravity will cause it to settle onto that object.
The objects A and B will come into contact with the objects C, D, E, and F due to the force of gravity.
When two objects come into contact due to gravity, they will exert forces on each other.
If the objects have different masses or densities, the heavier object may compress slightly under the weight of the lighter object.
If the objects are rigid and not deformable, they will simply rest on top of each other.

premise: Object A (yellow cube) will be placed on top of object C.
conclusion: Object A will be placed on top of object C.

premise: Object B (green cube) will be placed on top of object F.
conclusion: Object B will be placed on top of object F.
